verses.verse: To hym that excelleth in musick, a psalme of Dauid. Heare me, when I call, O God, of my ryghtewesnes: thou hast set me at lybertye, when I was in trouble: haue mercy vpon me, and herken vnto my prayer.
O ye sonnes of men, howe longe wyll ye blaspheme myne honoure, & haue soch pleasure in vanyte, and seke after lesyng? Sela.
Knowe thys also, that the Lorde hathe chosen to hym selfe the man that is godlye: when I call vpon the Lorde, he wyll heare me.
Stonde in awe, and synne not: comen with youre awne herte, and in youre chamber, and be styll. Sela.
Offer the sacryfyce of ryghtewesnesse, and put youre trust in the Lorde.
There be many that saye: who wyll shewe vs any good? Lorde lyfte thou vp the lyght of thy countenaunce vpon vs.
Thou hast putt gladnesse in myne herte, sence the tyme that theyr corne & wyne increased.
I wyll laye me downe in peace, and take my rest: for it is thou Lorde onely, that makest me dwell in safetye.
